text:
Created attachment 26637
file needed to reproduce the problem

Putting indexed images (PDFs and GIFs) result in crash of Adobe Reader on Macs when attempting to print the document. Viewing it is fine, its only when you try to print it then it crashes. Using Preview on mac is fine for both viewing and printing. Adobe Reader on other platforms works normally with same files. I don't know whether its Adobe Readers fault of FOP's problem, I just want to put out there. It's reliably reproducible and it results in crash every time. I would rather have it fixed by FOP team so I could update FOP on server and fix issue for all my Mac customers.

As soon as images are replaced by a non indexed images Adobe Reader stops crashing. As the results the PDFs are larger in size.

See below for FO and image files to reproduce the issue. No custom config.
creator: mike.starov@gmail.com

text:
Confirmed. I am also on Mac, and can reproduce the issue with Adobe Reader X. Trying to send one of the attached PDFs to the printer results in an application crash.

I am unfortunately no expert on images in PDF, so cannot say if we can do something about it from the FOP end.

Anyone?
creator: adelmelle@apache.org
gadams@apache.org
text: resetting P2 open bugs to P3 pending further review

creator: gadams@apache.org

text: batch transition resolved+wontfix to closed+wontfix; if you believe this remains a bug and can demonstrate it with appropriate input FO file and output PDF file (as applicable), then you may reopen
